intro: Mentha bracteolata, commonly known as the bracteolata mint, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a minty aroma. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in the summer months. Mentha bracteolata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
